meanings.definition: A group of people or things that are part of a larger group or organization.
meanings.sent1: During the parade, different contingents marched together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent2: The school's music contingent performed at the talent show.
meanings.sent3: The contingent of ducks waddled in a line, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The contingent of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The contingent of colorful balloons added a festive touch to the event.

meanings.definition: Dependent on chance or uncertain conditions.
meanings.sent1: The success of the plan was contingent on the weather cooperating.
meanings.sent2: Her happiness seemed contingent on receiving a positive response.
meanings.sent3: The cat's decision to nap in the sun was contingent on finding the perfect spot.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as contingent as the changing weather.
meanings.sent5: The outcome of the game was contingent on the last-minute goal.
